page.title: 04HOUSES AND BUILDINGS
page.content: In Shelford there are six main types of housing.These are cottages,mainly Victorian or modern but there are some older than Victorian.A new housing group has been put on West Street.They have nice modern names like Hebron and Tarka! An example of a Victorian house is Holly Cottage or Scarborough House. A sign that the houses are Victorian is the brick work and in some cases the surroundings.Walnut Tree Cottage is an old cottage.It has been in a lady called Mrs Fishers family for four hundred years.There is a big church on Church Street and it is the only church in Shelford.It is attractive,and in the church yard there are conifers and deciduous trees.
